newsitem.title: MONACO: SOCCER SHOWCASE-MONACO UNDERLINE CHAMPIONSHIP POTENTIAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-MONACO UNDERLINE CHAMPIONSHIP POTENTIAL.

text.p: Brazilian Anderson scored a superb second goal as Monaco confirmed their French title credentials with a commanding 2-0 win over Paris Saint-Germain on Sunday.
Monaco, who went ahead with a header by midfielder Sylvain Legwinski in the 64th minute, moved seven points clear of second-placed PSG.
Just seven minutes after the first goal, Nigerian substitute Victor Ikpeba found Anderson with a fine long ball out of defence.
The Brazilian, having beaten the offside trap, shook off Bruno N'Gotty's late challenge to shoot past goalkeeper Bernard Lama and in off the far post.
Champions Auxerre won 3-2 at relegation-threatened Caen in Sunday's other match, conceding two goals in the final two minutes after lookng comfortable winners.
